title: Nicholas Breakspeare and Hugh of Evesham

data.title: Nicholas Breakspeare and Hugh of Evesham
data.solution:
unit = %w[_ one two three four five six seven eight nine]
teen = %w[eleven twelve] +
  %w[thir four fif six seven eigh nine].map { |p| p + 'teen' }
tens = %w[_ ten twenty thirty forty fifty sixty seventy eighty ninety]
mags = [nil, 'thousand'] + %w[m b tr quadr quint].map { |m| m + 'illion' }

smol = -> n {
  case n
  when 1..9   ; unit[n]
  when 11..19 ; teen[n - 11]
  else
    h, n = n.divmod 100
    a, b = n.divmod 10
    o = [(unit[h] + ' hundred' if h > 0), (' ' if h * n > 0)]
    if (11..19) === n
      o << teen[n - 11]
    else
      o += [(tens[a] if a > 0), ('-' if a * b > 0), (unit[b] if b > 0)]
    end
    o.compact.join
  end
}

cardinalize = -> n {
  return 'zero' if n == 0
  ([('negative' if n < 0)] + n.abs.digits(1000).zip(mags)
    .map { |c, m| [smol[c], m] if c > 0 }
    .reverse.flatten).compact * ' '
}

gets
puts $<.map { |x| cardinalize[x.to_i] }
data.statement:
Given [[N]] integers, print their English cardinal forms. For example, 525600 is spelled "five hundred twenty-five thousand six hundred".

<<Note:>> no "and", no commas, and hyphens to separate composite cardinals such as "forty-two".

testCases.title: Example
testCases.testOut: five hundred twenty-five thousand six hundred

testCases.title: Example + 1
testCases.testOut: five hundred twenty-five thousand six hundred one

data.inputDescription:
<<First line:>> [[N]], the number of integers to "translate" into English
<<Next [[N]] lines:>> the integers, [[Xi..]]

lastVersion.statementHTML:
Goal

Given N integers, print their English cardinal forms. For example, 525600 is spelled "five hundred twenty-five thousand six hundred".

Note: no "and", no commas, and hyphens to separate composite cardinals such as "forty-two".
Input
First line: N, the number of integers to "translate" into English
Next N lines: the integers, Xi..
Output
N lines of English cardinals
Constraints
-2^64 ≤ Xi < 2^64 (~18 quintillion)
Example
Input
1
525600
Output
five hundred twenty-five thousand six hundred
